name: Southern Two-toed Sloth
description: The Southern Two-toed Sloth is a slow-moving mammal known for its arboreal lifestyle and algae-covered fur.
spread_note: Found from Nicaragua to northern South America.
food_note: Digests food slowly, eating mostly at night.
reproduction: Gestation about 11.5 months, one infant born.
attractions: Fascinating in zoos for their leisurely movements and unique appearance.
projects_note: Threatened by deforestation; conservation focuses on habitat protection.
breeding: Bred in captivity for educational purposes.
